meanings.definition: To make someone annoyed or irritated.
meanings.sent1: His constant teasing was riling her up.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise from the construction site was really riling the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept riling the old cat, making her hiss in annoyance.
meanings.sent4: The politician's controversial speech was riling up the crowd, causing a stir of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The persistent buzzing of the fly was riling up the sleepy student in class.

meanings.sent1: The adventurous movie was riling up the audience with its thrilling scenes.
meanings.sent2: The coach's motivational speech was riling the team up for the big game.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies was riling up the children, making them eager for a treat.
meanings.sent4: The beat of the drums was riling up the crowd, creating an atmosphere of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected plot twist in the story was riling up the readers, keeping them engaged till the end.
